casebody.data:
Travis HIGGINS
v.
WILLIAMS ENERGY PARTNER, L.P., Williams Olefins, L.L.C., the Williams Company, Inc., XYZ Insurance Company, Chicago Bridge and Iron Company, and X Insurance Company Artie Hudson, Jeffery D. Wells
v.
Williams Olefins Development, L.L.C., et al Emile Wade and Patricia Wade
v.
The Williams Companies, Inc., et al. Leroy Mitchell
v.
Williams Companies, Inc., et al.
v.
Mark Bateast, Terrence Crosby, Blake Joseph, Tyrone Lawson, Alvin Long, Jr., Cheri Owens-Griffin, Mary Robinson, Bernard Sears, Aaron Stafford, Donitello Thomas, Calvin Vanner, Donald Wheaton, Asiag Williams, Marcus Wilson and Marcus Yates
v.
The Williams Companies, Inc., et al. No. 2019-C-0049 Supreme Court of Louisiana. March 6, 2019

Granted. The district court's judgment and the decision of the court of appeal are reversed, because there remain genuine issues of material fact as to whether the defendant is liable to this plaintiff as the result of an intentional act pursuant to La. Rev. Stat. 23:1032(B). See La. Code Civ. Proc. art. 966(D)(1). The matter is remanded to the district court for further proceedings.
